articles.title: 73rd Enlarged Plenary Meeting of UAWK Central Committee Held
articles.content:
73rd Enlarged Plenary Meeting of UAWK Central Committee Held 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- There took place here the 73rd enlarged plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) on Monday. 
					 Present at the meeting were members and alternate members of the C.C., UAWK and officials of the union in the capital and local areas. 
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of implementing the militant tasks set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address. 
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., UAWK, made a report to be followed by speeches. 
					
					 The reporter and speakers called upon the members of the union to redouble their efforts in the sense of responsibility that they are standing on the first line trench of the first echelon in defending socialism. 
					
					 They said that organizations of the UAWK should launch an intensive emulation at the model farms in the Songun era, grain production, stock-breeding, greenhouse vegetable, mushroom production and other fields so that signal successes may be achieved on the agricultural front. 
					
					 They called for glorifying this significant year to see the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with increased production of grain.

articles.title: Paektusan Prize Sports Games Open
articles.content:
Paektusan Prize Sports Games Open
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Prize Sports Games were opened with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street Monday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Participants in the games will compete in football, basketball, volleyball, ice hockey and other events in Pyongyang and the sports village in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials concerned, sportspersons and working people.
					
					 Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Ri Jong Mu in an opening speech called upon all players and coaches to intensify training the way anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu and give full play to the physical and technical ability they have cultivated and the Korean-style playing method in order to bring about good results.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, there took place a premier basketball men's game between the Pyongyang Sports Team and the Sports Team of Kim Chaek University of Technology.

articles.title: Delegation of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Delegation of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League led by Jong Yong Won, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Monday to take part in the meeting of the General Council of the World Federation of Democratic Youth to be held in Russia.

articles.title: School Youth and Children Start Study Tour of Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
articles.content:
School Youth and Children Start Study Tour of Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
 Hyesan, February 1 (KCNA) -- School youth and children from across the country began a study tour of leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 A kick-off ceremony took place in front of the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan City on Monday.
					
					 The participants in the study tour laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung of the monument and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Jang Hyon Chol, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a report at the ceremony to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers called on the study tour makers to fully demonstrate the dynamic and courageous traits as reliable reserves, advanced party and wing of the party steadfastly carrying forward the march to Mt. Paektu under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the study tour makers left for Pochonbo, flying flags of the DPRK, the youth league and study tour group, led by the flags bearing the beaming images of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Production of Traditional Medicines Goes Up in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Traditional Medicines Goes Up in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Koryo medicine pharmaceutical factories in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea launched a brisk drive to increase the production of efficacious traditional medicines.
					 Those in South Hwanghae and Ryanggang provinces has conducted a work to apply a computer-controlled monitoring and command system at worksites while activating the production through introduction of advanced science and technology.
					
					 Phyongchon and Yomju Koryo medicine pharmaceutical factories and many other units carried out their monthly production plan until Jan. 10.
					
					Meanwhile, those factories are striving to steadily improve the quality of medicines, updating their production processes.

articles.title: Waterway Project in South Hwanghae Province Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Waterway Project in South Hwanghae Province Progresses Apace
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Builders of the waterway in South Hwanghae Province have stepped up the construction in an aim to round off the first-stage project before the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They are paying primary attention to improving the quality of structure while pushing ahead with the construction as scheduled.
					
					 A series of technical innovations has been applied to the project.
					
					 One of them is a new additive for concrete mixture, developed in cooperation with experts of Pyongyang University of Architecture, which makes it possible to go on the construction even under freezing weather.
					
					 Now, the pipe-burying project and construction of tunnels and structures have been accelerated at the final stage.

articles.title: Development of World-Famous Products Gains Momentum
articles.content:
Development of World-Famous Products Gains Momentum
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Knitting mills in the DPRK have directed big efforts to producing world-famous products.
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un in the New Year address called on officials and workers of the light industry sector to increase the number of world-famous products and commodities with a competitive edge.
					
					 The Songyo Knitwear Factory has stepped up modernization of dyeing process while introducing new techniques into production.
					
					 The Hamhung Knitwear Factory has paid big efforts to developing men's and women's thermal underwear into world-famous products.
					
					 The same is true of the Kanggye Knitwear Factory and the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory.

articles.title: Various Kites Made
articles.content:
Various Kites Made
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has made various kites.
					 Typical of them are those with the shapes of stingaree, octopus, fish and butterfly.
					
					 When interviewed by KCNA, Pak Son Hui, director of the branch academy, said:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un has paid deep attention to making different shapes of kites to delight children.
					
					 Thanks to his loving care, more than 30 designs were created by the Central Industrial Art Guidance Bureau, the Mansudae Art Studio and Pyongyang University of Fine Arts. And the branch academy developed a new cloth for kite.
					
					 The new kites were already sent to the Wonsan orphans' primary and secondary schools.

articles.title: KCNA Brands Japan-S. Korea "Agreement" on Sexual Slavery as Politically Motivated Artifice
articles.content:
KCNA Brands Japan-S. Korea "Agreement" on Sexual Slavery as Politically Motivated Artifice
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- KCNA issued an indictment on Jan. 31 as regards the fact that the issue of the unprecedented sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army spawned by the Japanese imperialists' colonial military fascist rule over Korea and their aggression of the continent in the past century is being misused by the hostile forces for attaining their sinister purpose.
					 It said:
					
					 As already reported, talks were held between the Japanese and south Korean foreign ministers in Seoul on Dec. 28 last year all of a sudden.
					
					 At the talks an "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army was announced at a lightening speed without leaving any official document required by provisions and procedures of international law as a result of Japan's impudent stand and south Korea's humiliating attitude.
					
					 Lurking behind Japan's recent negotiations with south Korea is the former's black-hearted intention to keep its history of past crimes buried into oblivion through the publication of the "agreement" and prevent it from being brought to the international arena again.
					
					 What the present south Korean ruling forces did recently, kowtowing to the U.S. and Japan, is the hideous sycophantic and treacherous acts which should be cursed down through generations.
					
					 Their shameless pro-Japanese behavior found a vivid manifestation in the facts that they refrained from uttering even a word of protest when Japan blustered 0.3 billion yen would be enough to solve the "issue of comfort women" and if it remains adamant, south Korea will move of itself and the former got facilities for forcible drafting of Koreans in the past registered as a world heritage.
					
					 The group of traitors is going foolish to lay a springboard favorable for their long-term office even by selling off the dignity and interests of the Korean nation and serving and yielding to the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 The above-said "agreement" is a product of plots hatched by the U.S. by wire-pulling Japan and south Korea for the purpose of tightening its alliance with them from A to Z, the indictment noted, and went on:
					
					 In recent years the U.S. has taken a lot of pain to clear the differences between Japan and south Korea in understanding the history, one of the biggest obstacle in the way of strengthening its alliance.
					
					 The U.S. turned a blind eye to the Japanese chief executive and feigned ignorance of it when the latter craftily shunned the admission, apology and reflection on Japan's war of aggression against the Asian countries in the past. It even pretended to know nothing of the fact that he insulted many women who suffered the shame as sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army by painting them as "victims of the flesh traffic".
					
					 The U.S. put pressure on the south Korean authorities to cover up Japan's past crimes, claiming that it was necessary to go forward without looking back on history and it wished to see the south Korea-Japan relations back on tract during the south Korean chief executive's junket to the U.S.
					
					 This diplomacy of appeasement and pressure on the part of Washington resulted in holding negotiations between rulers of Japan and south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean chief executive's U.S. junket was soon followed by the Japan-south Korea "summit" at which they promised to settle the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army till the end of that year.
					
					 The U.S. was also deeply involved in the Japan-south Korea negotiations for reaching an "agreement".
					
					 Washington strongly urged the talks between officials concerned and insisted that they were attended by high-ranking officials. This resulted in the talks between the foreign ministers of Japan and south Korea on Dec. 28 last year at which an "agreement" was made, leaving no written document.
					
					 As seen above, the "agreement" was made according to the scenario of the White House to use its two stooges as a shock brigade for carrying out its aggressive strategy for dominating Asia.
					
					 The above-said "agreement" characterized by high-handed, cunning and humiliating behaviors is the hideous politically-motivated swindle in the 21st century as it insulted and mocked at the Korean nation and human conscience for attaining the sinister goal of the war-like forces.
					
					 The hostile forces should certainly pay for this thrice-cursed criminal act of disregarding international justice.

articles.title: Victims of Sexual Slavery in S. Korea Demand Japanese PM Make Direct Apology
articles.content:
Victims of Sexual Slavery in S. Korea Demand Japanese PM Make Direct Apology
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Ri Ok Son and Kang Il Chul, south Korean victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, held a news conference in Tokyo on Jan. 26 to denounce the Japanese authorities for covering up the crimes related to sexual slavery, according to the south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News.
					 The victims said that they were forcibly drafted for sexual slavery and subject to all disgrace and pain.
					
					 They said that the south Korean and Japanese authorities "agreed" on the issue of the sexual slavery with a petty amount of money, ignoring the victims.
					
					 They shouted that nobody can pull down the girl statue before the Japanese embassy in Seoul.
					
					 They said what they want is for the Japanese prime minister to personally kneel down and make an apology and legal reparation for the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.

articles.title: Large-scale Action Denouncing Present Regime Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Large-scale Action Denouncing Present Regime Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations including the Headquarters of the All-out People's Action held a press conference on kicking off a ceremony for declaring the action for punishing the present regime at the conference room of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions on Jan. 28, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The organizations said they would hold a large-scale all-people rally on Feb. 27 to oppose the unpopular rule of the authorities.
					
					 They noted that they would stage large-scale actions in Seoul and other parts of south Korea to judge the authorities' retrogressive revision of the labor law, failure of economy and destitution of people's life.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Retrogressively Revise Labor Law
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Retrogressively Revise Labor Law
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of Trade Unions held a rally at Seoul Railway Station on Jan. 29 to stage an all-out action against the authorities' retrogressive revision of the labor law, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea. 
					 Attending there were more than 3,000 representatives of trade unions across south Korea.
					
					 Speakers termed the "double guidelines" and the bill for retrogressively revising the "labor law" as ones for depriving all the workers of their right and the bill for destroying the people's life and killing economy.
					
					 The "government's" guidelines are null and void, they said, declaring that they would stage an all-out action for disabling them and certainly punish the regime and political parties propelling the retrogressive revision of the labor law.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the rally.
					
					 It said they would launch large-scale actions for the dignity of the workers in solidarity with organizations.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: Sit-in Strike Staged in S. Korea to Demand Cancellation of Humiliating "Agreement"
articles.content:
Sit-in Strike Staged in S. Korea to Demand Cancellation of Humiliating "Agreement"
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean University Students Measure Committee to Denounce South Korea-Japan Negotiations has staged a sit-in strike outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul, according to website News 1 of south Korea. The strigke began on Dec. 29 last year demanding the checking of the withdrawal of the girl statue and cancellation of the "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery.
					 During the period the strikers conducted signature campaign among citizens, explained the meaning of the girl statue to them and brought to light the unreasonableness of the humiliating "agreement".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Myanmar, Russian Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Myanmar, Russian Personages
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Personages of Myanmar and Russia made public their statements on Jan. 22 and 26 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Tha Win, member of the Central Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar who doubles as secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the party, said that Kim Jong Il clearly indicated the way of accomplishing the cause of global independence through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 The most important exploit performed by Kim Jong Il for the victorious advance of the cause of global independence was that he smashed the imperialists' moves and firmly defended the country's sovereignty and peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world by pursuing his original Songun politics, he added, .
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in accomplishing the socialist cause are the greatest ones.
					
					 He stressed that Kim Jong Il's undying feats are being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un and will always be remembered by the world progressives.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 74th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Russia on Jan. 26.
					 The preparatory committee consists of personages of the organizations for the study of the Juche idea in Russia including the Russian Institute of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism and the Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events such as a seminar on works of Kim Jong Il and meeting on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Peru
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Peru
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Lima on Jan. 26.
					  Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events such as a meeting, seminar and photo and book exhibition to praise the revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in India
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in India
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- An Indian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Jan. 27.
					 The general secretary of the Indian National Congress Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events at Indian political parties, organizations for friendship and solidarity with the DPRK and organizations for the study of the Juche idea to praise the revolutionary careers and undying feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion ampliada de CC de UTAC
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion ampliada de CC de UTAC
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en esta capital la reunion ampliada de la 73a sesion plenaria del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea.
					Tomaron parte en la ocasion los miembros y los suplentes del CC de la UTAC, y los funcionarios del centro y las localidades de esa organizacion.
					
					En la ocasion fueron discutidos los problemas para materializar las tareas presentadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un en su mensaje del Ano Nuevo 2016.
					
					El presidente del CC de la UTAC, Ri Myong Gil pronuncio el informe y otros intervinieron.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que los miembros de la UTAC deben cumplir el plan de produccion cerealera con la responsabilidad de ocupar la primera posicion en la primera linea de la defensa del socialismo. 
					
					Senalaron que las organizaciones de la UTAC deben levantar furiosamente una oleada de emulacion en las granjas ejemplares de la epoca del Songun y otras unidades incluyendo las bases de produccion cerealera, ganadera, las verduras de invernadero y de hongos para obtener notables exitos en el frente agricola.
					
					Exhortaron a glorificar con el incremento  de produccion cerealera este ano significativo en que se convocara el Septimo Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: Inaugurada competencia deportiva por premio Paektusan
articles.content:
Inaugurada competencia deportiva por premio Paektusan
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del  natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quedo inaugurada competencia deportiva por el premio Paektusan.
					En esta ocasion se desarrollaran en esta capital y la villa deportiva en la zona del monte Paektu los juegos de varias disciplinas inclusive futbol, baloncesto, voleibol y jockey sobre hielo.
					
					La ceremonia de apertura tuvo lugar el dia primero en el Centro de Baloncesto de la capitalina Avenida Chongchun.
					
					A la cita asistieron Ri Il Hwan, jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, los funcionarios de la rama interesada, los deportistas y trabajadores.
					
					Ri Jong Mu, ministro de Deportes, exhorto, en su discurso inaugural, a todos los jugadores y entrenadores a avivar mas el fervor de entrenamiento de Paektu y lograr buenos exitos manifestando plenamente en cada juego el metodo competitivo al estilo coreano.
					
					Terminado el acto, tuvo lugar el juego de baloncesto masculino de categoria A entre los Conjuntos Deportivos de Pyongyang y la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek.

articles.title: ACNC califica de fraude politico el  "acuerdo" Japon-Sur de Corea sobre problema de esclavitud sexual
articles.content:
ACNC califica de fraude politico el  "acuerdo" Japon-Sur de Corea sobre problema de esclavitud sexual 
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que el problema de esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones, surgido en el siglo pasado a causa de la agresion al continente y la dominacion militar colonial y fascista del territorio coreano por parte del imperialismo japones, se malemplea por las fuerzas hostiles, la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea hizo publica el dia 31 de enero el siguiente acta de acusacion:
					Como es conocido por todos, el 28 de diciembre del ano pasado, se efectuaron apresuradamente en Seul las conversaciones de ministros de Relaciones Exteriores Japon-Sur de Corea.
					
					En esta cita ambas partes llegaron a un "acuerdo" sin dejar ni un documento oficial segun las formalidades legales internacionales, acordandose el cinismo de Japon y la actitud avasallante del Sur de Corea. 
					
					Japon se sento a la mesa de las presentes negociaciones a fin de dejar en el secreto de la historia sus crimenes del pasado e impedir la discusion de este tema en la palestra internacional.
					
					La actitud de los gobernantes surcoreanos sirvientes de EE.UU. y Japon es el crimen antinacional y vendepatria. 
					
					Ellos no dijeron ni una palabra de protesta cuando Japon disparateo: "se resolvera el problema de consoladoras con 300 mil millones de yenes" y "si persiste en su opinion el Sur de Corea lo aceptara" e insistio sin escrupulos en registrar como patrimonios mundiales los establecimientos donde los coreanos sufrieron el trabajo forzoso por el imperialismo japones.
					
					Los traidores surcoreanos actuan como imbeciles para preparar el trampolin favorable a prolongar su mandato vendiendo la dignidad e interese de la nacion coreana y adulando y obedeciendo a ciegas a EE.UU. y Japon. 
					
					El presente "acuerdo" es el producto de complot de EE.UU. que manipulo detras de la cortina de las negociaciones a Japon y el Sur de Corea a fin de consolidar la alianza. 
					
					En los ultimos anos el imperio se ha enfrascado en eliminar la discordia en el debate de la concepcion de la historia entre Japon y el Sur de Corea, tema considerado como mayor obstaculo en la consolidacion de la alianza. 
					
					Hizo la vista gorda cuando el gobernante japones eludio de modo astuto reconocer la guerra de agresion cometida en el siglo pasado por el imperialismo japones contra los paises asiaticos y pedir perdon por el respecto, y a la larga, insulto como "victimas de trafico de seres humanos" a las mujeres que sufrieron la vida de esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones. 
					
					Cuando la mandataria surcoreana realizaba una visita a EE.UU., le ejercio presion diciendo que "hay que avanzar sin echar la vista atras a la historia" y que "EE.UU. desea la recuperacion de las relaciones Sur de Corea-Japon". 
					
					EE.UU. indujo y coercio asi a los gobernantes de Japon y el Sur de Corea a hacer las negociaciones. 
					
					De esta manera, unos dias despues de la gira por EE.UU. de la mandataria surcoreana, tuvo lugar la Cumbre Japon-Sur de Corea, ocasion en la cual ambas partes comprometieron "arreglar" hasta finales del ano en curso el problema de esclavitud sexual. 
					
					EE.UU. se entremetio en las negociaciones Japon-Sur de Corea para obtener el "acuerdo". 
					
					Urgio y coercio fuertemente a hacer las conversaciones de funcionarios de alto rango. De esta manera, el 28 de diciembre ultimo sostuvieron las conversaciones de ministros de relaciones exteriores Japon-Sur de Corea. 
					
					El "acuerdo" sobre el caso de la esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito fue orquestado por la Casa Blanca que intenta utilizar a sus dos lacayos japones y surcoreano como brigadas de choque para el cumplimiento de la estrategia de hegemonia sobre Asia en el Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Pues, el "acuerdo" caracterizado por el despotismo, la astucia y la bajeza es el fraude politico del siglo XXI de las fuerzas belicistas que pisotean y burlan la conciencia de la nacion coreana y la humanidad para ganar sus designios malintencionados. 
					
					Se saldara sin falta la cuenta final del crimen de las fuerzas hostiles que dan espaldas a la justicia internacional.
